sect1.title: Build Flags
sect1.para: We will need to setup target specific flags for the compiler and linkers.
You will need to set your host target triplet for 32 bit:
Let's perform a sanity check to prevent build issues. If our LFS_HOST matches our target, we will get some failures during our cross-compile:

screen.userinput: if [ "${LFS_HOST}" = "${LFS_TARGET32}" ]; then \ echo "Host and Target can't be the same." ; fi

sect1.para: If the above test gave you "Host and Target can't be the same", you will need to change your LFS_HOST to a a different target triplet:
If the above test gave you an error, you will need to change your LFS_HOST to a a different target triplet:
Lets add the build flags to ~/.bashrc to prevent issues if we stop and come back later.

screen.userinput: echo export BUILD32=\""${BUILD32}\"" >> ~/.bashrc echo export BUILD64=\""${BUILD64}\"" >> ~/.bashrc echo export LFS_TARGET32=\""${LFS_TARGET32}\"" >> ~/.bashrc echo export LFS_HOST=\""${LFS_HOST}\"" >> ~/.bashrc
